bug.author: fpasch
bug.description: Since <denchmark-link:https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla/pull/1348>#1348</denchmark-link> , Carla SensorData contains a timestamp. Unfortunately this diverges from the timestamp reported by world.on_tick(). The longer you run Carla Server, the greater the difference gets. It seems that GetWorld().GetTimeSeconds() reports the wrong time. Tested with parameters: -benchmark -fps=20

comments.comment: It could be a float precision issue. UWorld stores the elapsed time in a float, but our world stores this same value in a double. Check out this code snippet <denchmark-link:http://coliru.stacked-crooked.com/a/cff4ce9edfaa54dc>http://coliru.stacked-crooked.com/a/cff4ce9edfaa54dc</denchmark-link>
